detaileddescription.para: Sufficient memory should be supplied to hold filter state. Allocate CHMAP_FILTER_INST_SIZE bytes for this purpose.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct chmap_instance *p_inst, uint8_t ch_idx, uint16_t crc_ok, uint8_t crc_error)
memberdef.name: chmap_filter_crc_update

simplesect.para: true when channel map update is recommended
pointer to CHMAP_BLE_BITMAP_SIZE sized channel map array

briefdescription.para: Confirm that suggested channel map has been applied.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used to keep internal state consistent with actual channel map used. There will always be a brief period of inconsistency when a new channel map is applied, which is to be expected.
Parameter update follow the read-modify-write pattern. Use chmap_filter_params_get to get the full set of parameters, make desired adjustments, then chmap_filter_params_set to set updated parameters.

simplesect.para: Parameters will be applied when chmap_filter_process is called.

parameterdescription.para: if one or more parameters are invalid.

briefdescription.para: Get bitmask of currently blacklisted wifi channels.

simplesect.para: As blacklist updates happen asynchronously, chmap_filter_process needs to run after chmap_filter_blacklist_set for the information returned from this function to be valid.
Bitmask of wifi channels. E.g. channel 6 and channel 8 = (1 << 6) | (1 << 8) = 320

detaileddescription.para: One or more channels can be blacklisted. It does not matter if channels overlap. The blacklist will not be accepted if the total number of blacklisted BLE channels exceeds the minimum channel count param.

simplesect.para: Blacklist can be partially added if more than one channel is blacklisted and function return is non-zero. Use chmap_filter_wifi_blacklist_get to confirm.

parameterdescription.para: Bitfield of blacklisted wifi channels. E.g. wifi channel 6 = (1 << 6)
if blacklist exceeds minimum channel count.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct chmap_instance *p_inst, uint8_t chn_idx, uint8_t *p_state, int16_t *p_rating, uint8_t *p_freq)
memberdef.name: chmap_filter_chn_info_get

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to hold frequency value [2400 + x MHz]
if p_inst or chn_idx is invalid
